moves.1. Nf3 d5 2. d4 Bg4: aggressive play - going for a knight trap
moves.3. e3: support from queen to not ruin potential kings castle later on
moves.5... Qf6: another aggressive move - (which is fine with me)
moves.9. Nc3: after i did this i thought "should have moved bishop to d2" this way bishop/knight combo going into the end game
moves.12. O-O: i predicted black kings castle here and was incorrect - watch..
moves.13... Nb6 14. a5 Nc4 15. Ra4 O-O 16. e4: about to exchange rooks - (en-passe coming up)
moves.17. axb6 e.p. axb6 18. Rxa8 Rxa8: have to move the bishop otherwise black rook to trap bishop
moves.22. Ra1 Ne2+: knight fork - (he should have taken the bishop on this - u will see why later on)
moves.23. Kf1 Nxd4: this move surprised me - I thought another exchange
moves.24. Bh3: attempting to force the black rook off back line
moves.25... g6: this opened up a lane for black bishop
moves.26. Ra6: going for a pawn/knight here with a bishop sacrifice to make up 1 pt
moves.26... b5: easily blocked - still trying to move rook off backline
moves.28. Be7: trying to force rook off row 6
moves.28... Rd5: that's how you use bishops in unison - rook can only move to d5 without getting killed
moves.29. Bf6: positioning bishop to assist with checkmate - while attempting to make him think of the sacrifice
moves.29... h6: he saw it - but it was too late
